pullRequest.body:
Let `B` be an `A`-algebra. Then

- `B` is faithfully flat over `A` if and only if it is flat and induces a surjective map on prime spectra.
- If `B` is flat and local over `A`, it is faithfully flat.

Co-authored by: Sihan Su <ssh@stu.pku.edu.cn>
Co-authored by: Yi Song <sif4delta0@mail.ustc.edu.cn>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #20700
- [x] depends on: #20715 
- [x] depends on: #21497

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+
This shouldn't be here.

I agree, it is not easy to find a good place for it though. I now moved it to `RingTheory.Spectrum.Prime.Basic` which causes +20% imports there, because it needs `RingTheory.Ideal.Over`, but I am reluctant to make a new file for this. `find_home!` yields
```
[Mathlib.RingTheory.Jacobson.Ring, Mathlib.RingTheory.Spectrum.Prime.Topology, Mathlib.RingTheory.Valuation.LocalSubring, Mathlib.RingTheory.DedekindDomain.Ideal]
```
but neither of these look reasonable to me.
In that case can you maybe split `RingTheory.Ideal.Over`?
This looks similar to `Module.tensorProduct_mk_one_injective_of_isScalarTower` in the other file.
Oops, forgot to remove that one.

```suggestion
lemma Module.FaithfullyFlat.of_primeSpectrum_specComap_surjective [Flat A B]
```
Since it is `RingHom.specComap` I renamed it to `of_specComap_surjective` instead.

```suggestion
/-- If `A` is local and `B` is a local, flat `A`-algebra, then `B` is faithfully flat. -/
```
Does this file still need anything about localizations?
Yes, but this is not the issue with the remaining `big import`. I'll need to get rid of the finiteness and polynomials.
Ah, I think I found a different solution. We don't need `Ideal.Over` anymore in `Spectrum.Prime.RingHom` if we move one lemma in a different place.

```suggestion
lemma injective_iff_exact_zero {M N : Type*} (P : Type*)
```
Maybe we can switch the LHS and the RHS and make it a `simp` lemma.
Same.

```suggestion
lemma PrimeSpectrum.mem_range_comap_iff {p : PrimeSpectrum R} :
```
This is the standard convention I think, but do as you wish.

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun e â†¦ Module.Flat.rTensor_exact _ e,
```
Similarly below.
Can this be `simp`? Same below.
Can you use `Type*` here?
Can you create a section with `variable [Module.FaithfullyFlat A B]` rather than adding it to various lemmas? Or maybe move the results that require it at the end without a section, as you prefer.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/FaithfullyFlat): equivalent characterizations for algebras
